intro: Leandra sanguinea subsp. tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments at high elevations, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a waxy texture. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its high-altitude habitat.
